PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.Matrix_Puller module¶

PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.Matrix_Puller.Analyze_relations(Current, number, AdditionalInfos=None)[source]¶

Just a way to print out the nodes making pass the most of the current.

Historically a reporting function, not essential for the matrix manipulation. Should be moved elsewhere.

Parameters:
  • Current (numpy array) – current running through the graph laplacian of a current system.
  • number (integer) – the number of the most important relations one wants to observe
  • AdditionalInfos – controls if additional informations will be added to the output. Defaults to None
PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.Matrix_Puller.Compute_and_Store_circulation(handle, List_of_UPs, mongo_db_collection)[source]¶

Computes information circulation for a set of uniprots, then pickles the result stores them in a mongoDB

Parameters:
  • handle – name of the entity to store under the ID
  • List_of_UPs – list of Uniprot Nodes on which we are willing to perform the retrieval and storage
  • mongo_db_collection – pymongo mongoDB client attachement
Returns:

Informativity array that was stored
PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.Matrix_Puller.Compute_circulation_intensity(epsilon=1e-10)[source]¶

performs the information circulation calculation in agreement with the publication by Misiuro et al, but with algorithm slightly modified for more rapid computation of information circulation

Warning:this method performs the computation on the whole set Uniprots, and thus it’s convergence time as a single process is overa month.
Parameters:epsilon (float) – corrective factor for the calculation of Cholesky matrix. defaults to 1e-10
PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.Matrix_Puller.Compute_ponderated_info_circulation(UPs_2Binding_Affs)[source]¶

Should compute the information circulation wehre the flowing information is ponderated by the importance a given protein has for our analysis.

Parameters:UPs_2Binding_Affs – Dictionary linking UniprotNode_IDs to their relative importances for the ponderated information circ. calculation
Raises NotImplementedError:
 It is not implemented yet
PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.Matrix_Puller.Compute_random_sample(sample_size, iterations, epsilon=1e-10, name_version='')[source]¶

Performs the information circulation calculation in agreement with the publication by Misiuro et al, but with algorithm slightly modified for more rapid computation of information circulation Unlike them Method above, if the sample size is under 170, it converges in an hour instead of months.

Warning:

it’s computations are not reliable, since it computes a full informativity within a restricted set of proteins.
Parameters:
  • sample_size – Size of elements to randomly pull out of the uniprot list
  • iterations – Number of random pulls to perform from the uniprot list to get all the interesing thigns
  • name_version – suffix to add to the name before the storage to distinguish from the previous iterations.
  • epsilon (float) – corrective factor for the calculation of Cholesky matrix. defaults to 1e-10
PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.Matrix_Puller.Compute_truly_random_sample(rounds, iterations, epsilon, name_version='')[source]¶

Performs a computation of information circulation for pairs of randomly selected pairs of nodes. Unlike the previous method, it doesn’t have a group biais; and the whole matrix is supressed for n repetitions of information transfer. Only the nodes that transport any information in addition to their own (i.e.) non-isolated and non-leaf nodes. The result is returned and dumped as a new array that is name-versionned with the name_version argument.

Historically this method was used to calibrate the information circulation and rapidly find proteins that were transporting the most information

Parameters:
  • rounds – times random pairs will be selected
  • iterations – full rounds of informativity computation, each time informativity being added. More or less redoundant with rounds: the total number of iterations is iterations*rounds
  • epsilon – fudge, preventing overflow
  • name_version – calculation-specific string allowing to differnetiate the dump from the rest
PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.Matrix_Puller.Info_circulation_for_Single_Node(source_MatrixID, sinks_MatrixIDs, epsilon=1e-10)[source]¶

Computes the information circulation for a single node, according to a slightly improved method compared to the one described by Missiuro

Parameters:
  • source_MatrixID (int) – number of the row/line of the source node within the conductance matrix corresponding to the source
  • sinks_MatrixIDs (list of ints) – list of numbers of the rows/lines within the conductance matrix corresponding to sinks
  • epsilon (float) – corrective factor for the calculation of Cholesky matrix. defaults to 1e-10
PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.Matrix_Puller.analyze_Silverality()[source]¶

Plots the results of the Silverality Analysis, after undumping them

PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.Matrix_Puller.characterise_eigenvects(N_of_eigenvectors_to_characterise, Type='Adj')[source]¶

Recovers statistics over eigenvectors in order to remove excessively connected nodes.

Parameters:
  • N_of_eigenvectors_to_characterise – number of eigenvectors we would like to characterise
  • Type – if Type=’Adj’, the adjacency matrix eigenvectors will be processed. Otherwise a discrete laplacian will be used
Returns:

Names of the elements in the 100 biggest eigenvectors in the adjacency matrix
PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.Matrix_Puller.checkMatrix()[source]¶

Verifyes that the adjacency matrix has no elements with unexpected values. If there are, prints them, then throws an exception

Note:this constitutes one of the possible partitioning of the matrix into functional clusters.
Raises Exception:
 “Unexpected behavior among adjacency nodes!” if adjacency matrix has unexpected elements
PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.Matrix_Puller.check_Silverality(sample_size, iterations)[source]¶

Checks how rapidly the information passing through the neighbouring proteins decreases with the distance between them

Parameters:
  • sample_size – number of roots for the Silverality verification
  • iterations – how many passes for the Silverality verification
Returns:
PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.Matrix_Puller.columnSort()[source]¶

Computes the degree of adjacency for each node and writes it out in a human-readable format to a file specified in Dumps.Adj_degree

PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.Matrix_Puller.compute_sample_circulation_intensity(Sample, epsilon=1e-10, array_v='')[source]¶

Attention, this method shoyld never be called. Normally all the major IO operations on information arrays should be performed with the compute and store circulation method

performs the information circulation calculation in agreement with the publication by Misiuro et al, but with algorithm slightly modified for more rapid computation of information circulation

Parameters:
  • array_v – Array version, allowing it to vbe differentiated from other arrays on storage
  • Sample (list of ints) – List of row/column numbers that are to be used in the computation (~170 for a computation converging in less then an hour)
  • epsilon (float) – corrective factor for the calculation of Cholesky matrix. defaults to 1e-10
PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.Matrix_Puller.compute_sample_circulation_intensity_minimal(Sample, epsilon=1e-10)[source]¶

performs the information circulation calculation in agreement with the publication by Misiuro et al, but with algorithm slightly modified for more rapid computation of information circulation.

The informativities are calculated only by using the uniprot proteins as the source and extraction points. This reduces the number of interations from 25k to 5 and the number of LU decompositions in a similar manner

Parameters:
  • Sample (list of ints) – List of row/column numbers that are to be used in the computation (~170 for a computation converging in less then an hour)
  • epsilon (float) – corrective factor for the calculation of Cholesky matrix. defaults to 1e-10
Returns:

the informativity array
PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.Matrix_Puller.get_Current_all(Voltages, J)[source]¶

Recovers the current for all the nodes

Parameters:
  • J (numpy array) – Conductance matrix
  • Voltages (numpy array) – Informativity gradient in each node obtained by the solution of the matrix equation ConductanceMatrix*Voltage = J
Returns:

Currents throug each node.
Return type:

csc_matrix
PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.Matrix_Puller.processEigenVectors(nbiggest, Type='Adj')[source]¶

Recovers “nbiggest” elements with the biggest association to a given eigenvector and returns them.

Parameters:
  • nbiggest – number of biggest elements in a eigenvector to analyse
  • Type – if Type=’Adj’, the adjacency matrix eigenvectors will be processed. Otherwise a discrete laplacian will be used
Returns:

biggest element indexes in colums, where each column corresponds to the eigenvector and each column contains nbiggest elements
